title: Seeking clarification re NCE and NCI
body:
In the agile activities table, for the NCE and NCI fields, once a value has been submitted, the values are baselined and cannot be changed without a revise investment option. But at least the NCE field accepts fractions so a case can be made that at least the NCE field should not be baselined and the ITDB should accept updates as fractions of an epic are completed. Please advise if the intent behind base lining these fields is similar to the other "actual" fields (completed date, cost, etc) and OMB/ITDB expects the NCE and NCI fields to be updated only after all fractions of the epic have been completed.

Thank you.
Joe Gomes
USDA OCIO IRM CPTGD

title: Changing Agency Objectives and Goals Logic
body:
When looking to make changes to the set of agency strategic objectives and performance goals ("objectives",) there continue to be issues in the logic checking the objectives list and also in comparing it to the metric objectives.  

For example, when adding to the list of investment objectives where existing objectives are already in place, errors are generated if, in the same file, metrics are being re-assigned to the new objectives.  This necessitates providing a second file with the metrics.  

Additionally, in cases where the existing agency objective record is being changed from value 1 to value 2 and a new record is being created with value 1, an error is generated, apparently because the system adds the new record and determines there are now two records with value 1, before processing the update.  There is no simple workaround for this (particularly where metrics are using these values.)  We need to change the record IDs in our system to accomodate.

Another case that appears to have no workaround is where an investment has an objective with value 3 and a metric assigned to that objective.  The investment determines that it wants to change value 3 to value 4, both for the investment and the metric.  There appears to be no way to do this.  Instead, a new record needs to be added for the investment and the metric assigned to it.  Then, in a second file, the old record is deleted.

The general theme is that it appears that the logic for checking metrics could be improved.  In particular, I would expect the system to process all investment objective adds and updates before providing an error that there is a duplicate record.  Once that is complete, I would expect the system to process all metric adds and updates and determine if any metric objectives are invalid.

I know that it was discussed last year and not changed due to time constraints, but an option that may again be worth considering is moving to a simple list for the agency objectives and goals, similar to the Paperwork Reduction Act control numbers list.  This would avoid the problem of managing record numbers, adds, and updates for a list that contains one element.  As the majority of the issues we encounter with changing goals and objectives occur during the annual submission window, we could manage to continue working around the existing issues without a fix if something like this was planned for the BY20 submission.

title: Submitting a Blank List of PRA Control Numbers
body:
It appears the schema is not allowing the submission of a blank list of control numbers.  This may be necessary where a record was submitted and it no longer applies and/or was submitted in error and the investment should have no PRA control numbers associated with it.  I first attempted to do this with an annual submission and then with a monthly.  For the monthly, I attempted using all of the following (recognizing the first two and second two should be the same) to force a blank set of control numbers:

```
<tns:ombControlNumbers><tns:ombControlNumber></tns:ombControlNumber></tns:ombControlNumbers>
<tns:ombControlNumbers><tns:ombControlNumber/></tns:ombControlNumbers>
<tns:ombControlNumbers></tns:ombControlNumbers>
<tns:ombControlNumbers/>
```
All pass the XSD but all returned the error:

> ◦updateInvestmentDetails: 
> alertOMB Control Number is optional but if submitted must be entered in the following format: XXXX-XXXX.

I would expect that submitting one of the above should be understood to indicate that the list of control numbers is being overriden with a blank list.  Alternatively, a tag (similar to the "nil" attributes used in some areas) could be added to make it more explicit.

In either case, please advise as to the best way both to address the issue for the current investment (recognizing this may be a manual request to remove the data) and the plan for supporting this functionality long-term.

title: IT Dashboard Down
body:
Name: Ryan Dougherty
Organization: Booz Allen, supporting eCPIC PMO
Urgency: Low
Description of Issue: For your awareness, it appears that the myit-2019.itdashboard.gov sites was briefly down this morning. Several our Agencies reported connection errors, and we confirmed in our error logs that your application was unavailable. This downtime appears to be resolved, and our Agencies are currently connecting fine with the IT Dashboard site. Just wanted to make sure your team was aware of this.

title: Incorrect IT Security and Compliance Standard Investment Report Warnings
body:
As these are only warnings, this is not a critical issue for us during the current submission as we can ignore them.

When submitting multiple ITS&C SIRs in a single XML file, incorrect warnings are generated.  It appear some are due to the validations comparing the data for each SIR to the totals from the IT Investment Portfolio Summary for the first SIR, rather than the current SIR.  As an example:
```
check Submission Successful for UII 009-000000001
check Submission Successful for UII 009-000000002
costsAndCapabilities◦warning The sum of all IT security compliance capabilities for PY ( 2.100000 ) should exactly match Total Security and Compliance Cost PY ( 1.100000 ) from the investment in the IT Portfolio.
◦warning The sum of all IT security compliance capabilities for CY ( 2.200000 ) should exactly match Total Security and Compliance Cost CY ( 1.200000 ) from the investment in the IT Portfolio.
◦warning The sum of all IT security compliance capabilities for BY ( 2.300000 ) should exactly match Total Security and Compliance Cost BY ( 1.300000 ) from the investment in the IT Portfolio.
The sum of capabilities for the PY ( 2.100000 ) should not be greater than the DME and O&M Agency PY Funding and Agency PY Contributions ( 1.100000 ) from the IT Portfolio.
◦warning The sum of capabilities for the CY ( 2.200000 ) should not be greater than the DME and O&M Agency CY Funding and Agency CY Contributions ( 1.200000 ) from the IT Portfolio.
◦warning The sum of capabilities for the BY ( 2.300000 ) should not be greater than the DME and O&M Agency BY Funding and Agency BY Contributions ( 1.300000 ) from the IT Portfolio.
```
In the above, example, no warnings are received for 009-000000001 because the totals match.  However, 009-000000002 receives the above warnings even though $2.1m, $2.2m, and $2.3m are the correct numbers.  The amounts referenced in the warnings - $1.1m, $1.2m, and $1.3m - are the values for 009-000000001.  Note that if I also submit 009-000000003, warnings will continue to reference values from 009-000000001.  

Additionally, the calculations for the 10% warning on "Other" appear not to be reset to 0 for each SIR.  As an example:

```
check Submission Successful for UII 009-000000004
◦warning The amount of spending reported for Other Identify Capabilities (6) for PY ( 2.000000) for this investment should not exceed 10% of the total PY ( 2.000000) for all NIST Framework Category Identify for this investment
check Submission Successful for UII 009-000000005
◦warning The amount of spending reported for Other Identify Capabilities (6) for PY ( 3.000000) for this investment should not exceed 10% of the total PY ( 1.000000) for all NIST Framework Category Identify for this investment
```

In the above example, 009-000000004 has $2m in Other Identify, and it is correctly identified as having the entire $2m of Identify in "Other".  However, 009-000000005 is listed as having $3m in Other Identify, out of a total of $1m in Identify.  This does not make sense as "Other" cannot exceed 100%, and it appears that the issue is that the $3m comes from adding the totals for 009-000000004 and 009-000000005 rather than resetting them and showing $1m, the correct value in this case.  Note that 009-000000006 would continue to add, so if it had $0.5m in other, the warning would be based on $3.5m.

title: CIO Rating API Erasing Data
body:
Name: Ryan Dougherty
Organization: Booz Allen, supporting eCPIC PMO
Urgency: High
Description of Issue: The CIO Rating API is deleting encoded ampersands and the following data within the CIO Comments. This issue appears to be isolated to the CIO Rating API. In the submission file below, you can see we submit  "migration&test.", however only "migration" is returned. 

Request:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<operations xmlns="http://www.itdashboard.gov/service" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.itdashboard.gov/service ../Exchange/serviceRequest.xsd" validateOnlyIndicator="false">
  <cioRatingInformation uniqueInvestmentIdentifier="011-000100086">
    <monthlySubmission>
      <setCIORating id="90c3ba8e-b4b7-4ba5-b7af-6c24163097d2">
        <cioRatingEval>3</cioRatingEval>
        <cioComment>migration&test.</cioComment>
      </setCIORating>
    </monthlySubmission>
  </cioRatingInformation>
</operations>
```

Response:
```
<sr:operationResults xmlns:sr="urn:us:gov:CIORating" xmlns="http://www.itdashboard.gov/service" validateOnlyIndicator="false" submissionId="978841" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.itdashboard.gov/serviceResponse ../Exchange/serviceResponse.xsd" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <sr:investment uniqueInvestmentIdentifier="General Warning">
    <sr:success>
      <sr:message level="warning" xpath="String">Warning: Agencies are required to submit a CIO Evaluation Report only for their major investments. It is Optional for all other investments. There are 10 investments without an optional CIO Evaluation Report.</sr:message>
    </sr:success>
  </sr:investment>
  <sr:investment uniqueInvestmentIdentifier="011-000100086">
    <sr:success>
      <sr:setCIORatingResult id="81175">
        <sr:CIORating>
          <sr:cioRatingEval>3</sr:cioRatingEval>
          <sr:cioComment>migration</sr:cioComment>
        </sr:CIORating>
      </sr:setCIORatingResult>
    </sr:success>
  </sr:investment>
</sr:operationResults>
```

title: Validation of Eliminated/Reduced Investment table issue
body:
Submitter: Barry Pannell
Org: DHS/MBC
Issue: We have 2 continuing investments that we are attempting to update.  Last year these investments identified other investments that were being 'eliminated/reduced' as a result of the investment work.  This year some of those investments are no longer on the IT Portfolio so they can not be referenced in the Reduced/Eliminated Investments table.  I am trying to deactivate them but validation says that the UII does not exist in the IT Portfolio so I am getting a validation error.  
Will send along a test file shortly. 
I also tried removing the 'deactivation' from the file but it still failed.  

Recommendation: Do not validate the UII on a deactivation activity.  

Will take a work around if one is available.

title: Contract Dates Returned in Odd Format
body:
Name: Ryan Dougherty
Organization: Booz Allen, supporting eCPIC PMO
Urgency: Low
Description of Issue: The Get File Response is sending back date values in the Day + Time format. We are submitting dates in the mm/dd/yyyy format. We would expect values to be returned in the same format as our submissions.

Request Node Format: `<anticipatedAwardDate>08/19/2017</anticipatedAwardDate>`

Get File Response Format: `<anticipatedAwardDate>2017-08-19 00:00:00</anticipatedAwardDate>`

title: Errors and Submission Scenarios
body:
Name: Ryan Dougherty
Organization: Booz Allen, supporting eCPIC PMO
Urgency: Medium
Description of Issue: There are currently two AITPS validation errors that are listed Github, which will prevent Agencies from executing the submission scenarios laid out within the three white-boarding sessions and the following deck released to vendors and the community. 

One error prevents eliminated investments from having either BY or CY funding. And another error prevent new investments from having a Prior UII. Is OMB planning on updating these errors?
